page.title: 09The River Mill, St Ives
page.content: The River Mill is situated to the south of the medieval St Ives bridge. The mill was built in 1835. In it's long history it has been a steam powered flour mill, a printing works, and more recently, an electronics factory owned by Thandar Electronics Ltd. For some years prior to 1979 it was the home of Sinclair Radionics Ltd. Thandar manufacture hi_tech electronic test equipment and have both national and international markets. The company employs 75 people at present but it hopes to expand production in the future. The work force which is mainly female, live locally. They work a 37.5 hour week from 8.00 a.m. to 4.30 p.m. Thandar electronics are one of many electronics firms in this part of East Anglia, indicating a trend away from rural to technological industry.
